Package app

Class Settings

java.lang.Object
app.Settings
public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object

Settings

The settings class stores settings information dictating how the program should operates.

Ex. of settings file below

"
#settings
LogFileName=brew.log
CoolerState=1
HeaterState=0
HasHeater=0
DiffPlus=0.5
DiffMinus=0.5
CoolerIp=192.168.2.52
HeaterIp=0
LogFreq=1
Onoffdelay=10
#days;temp
!state=Ferment
14;12
!state=Diactyl rest
3;16.66
!state=Lager cooldown
1;13.89
"
Since:
2020-23-9

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.lang.String coolerIp
    The String represents the ip of the coolers wireless relay.
    protected boolean coolerState
    The Boolean represents the state of the coolers wireless relay.
    protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> dailyState
    A String containing String state positioned by day where 0 is day 1, x is day-1.
    protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> dailyTemp
    A LinkedList containing TempDateTime temperature, date and time positioned by day where 0 is day 1, x is day-1.
    protected boolean hasHeater
    The Boolean represents if the program should support a heater connected to a wireless relay.
    protected java.lang.String heaterIp
    The LinkedList represents the ip heaters wireless relay.
    protected boolean heaterState
    The String represents the state of the heaters wireless relay.
    protected java.lang.String logFileName
    The String represents the path of the logfile.
    protected double minutesToWaitLog
    The Double represents minutes to wait between logging.
    protected double minutesToWaitPowerSwitch
    The Double represents minutes to wait between switching on and off wireless relay.
    protected double tempErrorMarginMinus
    The Double represents temperature margin in negative direction.
    protected double tempErrorMarginPlus
    The Double represents temperature margin in positive direction.
    protected int totalDays
    The Integer represents total number of days to control temperature.
